Description:
This web service retrieves problem list and health status data from a patient's chart. This includes any data found in the patient chart across all encounters. Note that very few Epic organizations record a health status for patients, so in most cases this resource will be used to retrieve problem list items only. This resource can be queried by a combination of patient ID and status.

This resource returns a smaller subset of elements for health status conditions as compared to problem list items. For health status, severity, onsetPeriod, abatementPeriod, and note elements are not populated.

Some problems on the problem list may be marked with a class of "Health Concern", indicating that the problem is of special concern. Problems flagged with this special class will be returned alongside the other problems, however they will be annotated with a special category of health-concern.

Note that this resource retrieves only data stored in problem list (LPL) records. As a result, medical history data documented outside of a patient's problem list isn't available to applications using this service unless that data is retrieved using another method.

A user or staff member accessing this FHIR resource must have appropriate security to view problem list items and/or health status.

MyChart users must have security to see problem list information.

Patient-level break-the-glass functionality is in place for this resource.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
Always "health-concern" for this API.

Starting in August 2021, multiple category values are allowed if the requestor is authorized to search multiple Condition categories.
category.Optional: Optional in Epic version August 2021 and later. Required in earlier versions.

clinical-status.Name: clinical-status
clinical-status.Description:
Status of the condition

FHIR Status Epic Status
active active conditions
resolved resolved conditions
inactive deleted conditions

If no status is specified all active (confirmed) conditions will be returned.

*Note: Any FHIR Status not listed in the above table is not returned.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: Reference to a patient resource the condition is for.
patient.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to a patient resource the condition is for.
subject.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

Condition.Name: Condition
Condition.Description: An instance of the R4 Condition resource.

abatementPeriod.Name: abatementPeriod
abatementPeriod.Description: The date the condition was resolved.

clinicalStatus.Name: clinicalStatus
clinicalStatus.Description: The clinical status, which can be active, resolved, or inactive.

code.Name: code
code.Description: External codings for the condition. If a list of codes is sent, they're listed in this element. Otherwise, this element uses the problem name from the name element.

onsetPeriod.Name: onsetPeriod
onsetPeriod.Description: The date the problem was resolved.

recordedDate.Name: recordedDate
recordedDate.Description: The date the condition was recorded.

recorder.Name: recorder
recorder.Description: Reference to the practitioner who updated the health concern.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient associated with the condition.

verificationStatus.Name: verificationStatus
verificationStatus.Description: If this is on the patient's local chart, the value is "confirmed". If it is outside data, it is "unconfirmed".

total.Name: total
total.Description: Total number of resources that matched the search criteria.
